name: The 1936 Elections
description: It all comes down to this. Will the PNR hold on to the presidency or will the PNL manage to secure victory?

name: PNR Holds On
description: The Partido Nacional Revolucionario, focused on economic recovery through farming and investment, has won the 1936 elections.

name: Encourage Farming
description: In order to recover economically, we need to create a strong economic backbone through crop exports.

name: Encourage Foreign Investments
description: While the government is able to provide some money, it is not nearly enough for our economic plans. Despite our party's pledge against foreign influences, we will have to turn to the nations of the world.

name: Ensure National Police Loyalty
description: The highly conservative National Police is likely to not sit by while we encourage these major economic reforms in our nation. We should take steps to ensure their loyalty.

name: Support Further Investments
description: Now that we have ensured the National Police's loyalty, we can encourage further investment into our farming plan, and further our economic recovery.

name: Economic Recovery
description: Now that we have foreign investments for our farming plans, we have begun to implement them, and the depression is starting to fade into the pages of history.

name: PNL Victory
description: The Partido Nacional Liberal, focused on economic recovery through business investment and worker protection, has won the 1936 elections.

name: Protect Worker's Rights
description: To ensure a functioning society, we need to protect our agrarian and factory workers and ensure their rights are upheld.

name: Encourage Trade Unions
description: Although maybe not the best idea, encouraging trade unions will fully ensure that our workers are protected. Depending on how we manage this, we can either end up regulating or deregulating unions. On paper, unregulated unions would be the best choice, leaving the workers fully satisfied. However, unregulated unions would make other parties, and even the conservative faction of our own party, upset.

name: Invest in Panamanian Businesses
description: To ensure economic recovery, we should spend what funds we have investing on newly formed businesses in our nation. It has the added bonus of reducing our dependency on foreign nations.

name: Stimulate the Economy
description: We should encourage the upper classes to invest and spend more, giving the economy more money, leaving us in a far better position.

name: A Liberal Panama
description: The economic strife has ended, and now the economy is better than ever. We have truly made Panama great again.

name: National Police Coup
description: The National Police has couped the government!

name: Military Dictatorship
description: In order to ensure order and conservatism, we must establish a permanent presence in government.

name: New Panamanian Economy
description: We should use the vast resources of the Police to seize foreign investments and make a truly self-sufficient economy.

name: A Standing Army
description: Although we have seized foreign investments, the National Police will most likely be unable to compete on an international scale. To combat this, we should form a modern army.

name: A New Constitution
description: We should draft a new constitution for Panama so that all affairs will run through the military.

name: Preemptive Buildup
description: Both Costa Rica and Colombia have claims on our land. We should build up our military to ensure that we can defend our homeland.

name: Conservative Government
description: The Conservative wing of the PNL holds the presidency.

name: Create Export Goods
description: For our economic plans to work, we need private corporations to create goods to export.

name: Capitalist Economics
description: We should reduce taxes on the upper class so that they shall be more inclined to invest in businesses. Increased spending and hiring will also assist the lower class, and will solve our economic depression.

name: Remove Progressive Reforms
description: We should revoke the previous government's encouragement of unionizing, or at least modify it to reduce their power. We do not wish to end up with a Syndicalist revolution on our hands.

name: Status of the Party
description: Our government has existed for several months now. Officially, we are still the Partido Nacional Liberal, but some in our government suggest that we reform into a new Partido Conservador.

name: Forming a New Government
description: With the economic depression mostly solved, the progressive reforms gone, and exports ever-increasing, we should look to form a new government instead of sticking to the provisional post-Jovan√© government.
